alert.note: Alert for Brevard; Indian River; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Indian River and Osceola. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Rockledge, Sebastian, Cocoa, Cocoa Beach, Satellite Beach, Cape Canaveral, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores, Malabar, Indialantic, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Barefoot Bay, Patrick Air Force Base, Roseland, Sebastian Inlet, Sebastian Highlands, Merritt Island and Wabasso. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
